intro: Prenia pallens, commonly known as the pale prenia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with four to five petals. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in moist, shaded environments.
